results.title: The Small Irish Animation Studio That Keeps Getting Oscars’ Attention
results.abstract: With “Wolfwalkers,” Cartoon Saloon completes a hand-drawn trilogy based on Celtic mythology. The film epitomizes everything the studio stands for.

results.title: Tom Cruise Erupts at ‘Mission: Impossible’ Crew Over Covid-19 Breach
results.abstract: On a film set in Britain, the actor tore into the crew with an expletive-laden rant. Production of the blockbuster film had previously been delayed by the pandemic.

results.title: Watch the Stars of ‘Tenet’ Leap Tall Buildings
results.abstract: The writer-director Christopher Nolan discusses a scene that follows John David Washington and Robert Pattinson’s characters as they’re launched up the side of a tower. The movie is now available on demand.

results.title: Barbara Windsor, Beloved British TV and Film Star, Dies at 83
results.abstract: She went from bubbly sex symbol in the “Carry On” films to working-class hero on “EastEnders.” Her private life was often as troubled as her “EastEnders” character’s.
The Academy Museum of Motion Pictures pushed back its opening to Sept. 30, 2021, from April 30, citing the difficulty of forecasting when public life may begin to normalize.

results.title: Kim Ki-duk, Award-Winning South Korean Filmmaker, Dies at 59
results.abstract: He was celebrated for movies centered on society’s underbelly, but he was later accused of sexual misconduct. He died of Covid-19.

results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman’s documentary films offer an unparalleled, panoramic vision of society. His 45th feature, “City Hall,” is on PBS this month — and he’s eager to get back to work.
results.title: What if the Great American Novelist Doesn’t Write Novels?
How the Bee Gees Stayed Alive
results.abstract: The HBO documentary “The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart” traces the decades-long arc of a band that mastered a rare pop skill: adaptation.
